t: Matthew 19
Divorce
When*p Jesus had finished saying these things, he left Galilee and went into the region of Judea to the other side of the Jordan.
Large crowds followed him, and he healed them there.
Some*p Pharisees came to him to test him. They asked, “Is it lawful for a man to divorce his wife for any and every reason?”
“Haven’t*rp you*r read,”*r he replied, “that*r at*r the*r beginning*r the*r Creator*r ‘made*r them*r male*r and*r female,’*r
and*r said,*r ‘For*r this*r reason*r a*r man*r will*r leave*r his*r father*r and*r mother*r and*r be*r united*r to*r his*r wife,*r and*r the*r two*r will*r become*r one*r flesh’?*r
So*r they*r are*r no*r longer*r two,*r but*r one*r flesh.*r Therefore*r what*r God*r has*r joined*r together,*r let*r no*r one*r separate.”*r
“Why*p then,” they asked, “did Moses command that a man give his wife a certificate of divorce and send her away?”
Jesus*p replied, “Moses*r permitted*r you*r to*r divorce*r your*r wives*r because*r your*r hearts*r were*r hard.*r But*r it*r was*r not*r this*r way*r from*r the*r beginning.*r
I*r tell*r you*r that*r anyone*r who*r divorces*r his*r wife,*r except*r for*r sexual*r immorality,*r and*r marries*r another*r woman*r commits*r adultery.”*r
The*p disciples said to him, “If this is the situation between a husband and wife, it is better not to marry.”
Jesus*p replied, “Not*r everyone*r can*r accept*r this*r word,*r but*r only*r those*r to*r whom*r it*r has*r been*r given.*r

For*r there*r are*r eunuchs*r who*r were*r born*r that*r way,*r and*r there*r are*r eunuchs*r who*r have*r been*r made*r eunuchs*r by*r others—and*r there*r are*r those*r who*r choose*r to*r live*r like*r eunuchs*r for*r the*r sake*r of*r the*r kingdom*r of*r heaven.*r The*r one*r who*r can*r accept*r this*r should*r accept*r it.”*r
The Little Children and Jesus
Then*p people brought little children to Jesus for him to place his hands on them and pray for them. But the disciples rebuked them.
Jesus*p said, “Let*r the*r little*r children*r come*r to*r me,*r and*r do*r not*r hinder*r them,*r for*r the*r kingdom*r of*r heaven*r belongs*r to*r such*r as*r these.”*r
When he had placed his hands on them, he went on from there.
The Rich and the Kingdom of God
Just*p then a man came up to Jesus and asked, “Teacher, what good thing must I do to get eternal life?”
“Why*rp do*r you*r ask*r me*r about*r what*r is*r good?”*r Jesus replied. “There*r is*r only*r One*r who*r is*r good.*r If*r you*r want*r to*r enter*r life,*r keep*r the*r commandments.”*r
“Which*p ones?” he inquired. Jesus*p replied, “ ‘You*r shall*r not*r murder,*r you*r shall*r not*r commit*r adultery,*r you*r shall*r not*r steal,*r you*r shall*r not*r give*r false*r testimony,*r
honor*r your*r father*r and*r mother,’*r and*r ‘love*r your*r neighbor*r as*r yourself.’”*r
“All*p these I have kept,” the young man said. “What do I still lack?”

Jesus*p answered, “If*r you*r want*r to*r be*r perfect,*r go,*r sell*r your*r possessions*r and*r give*r to*r the*r poor,*r and*r you*r will*r have*r treasure*r in*r heaven.*r Then*r come,*r follow*r me.”*r
When*p the young man heard this, he went away sad, because he had great wealth.
Then*p Jesus said to his disciples, “Truly*r I*r tell*r you,*r it*r is*r hard*r for*r someone*r who*r is*r rich*r to*r enter*r the*r kingdom*r of*r heaven.*r
Again*r I*r tell*r you,*r it*r is*r easier*r for*r a*r camel*r to*r go*r through*r the*r eye*r of*r a*r needle*r than*r for*r someone*r who*r is*r rich*r to*r enter*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God.”*r
When*p the disciples heard this, they were greatly astonished and asked, “Who then can be saved?”
Jesus*p looked at them and said, “With*r man*r this*r is*r impossible,*r but*r with*r God*r all*r things*r are*r possible.”*r
Peter*p answered him, “We have left everything to follow you! What then will there be for us?”

Jesus*p said to them, “Truly*r I*r tell*r you,*r at*r the*r renewal*r of*r all*r things,*r when*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r sits*r on*r his*r glorious*r throne,*r you*r who*r have*r followed*r me*r will*r also*r sit*r on*r twelve*r thrones,*r judging*r the*r twelve*r tribes*r of*r Israel.*r

And*r everyone*r who*r has*r left*r houses*r or*r brothers*r or*r sisters*r or*r father*r or*r mother*r or*r wife*r or*r children*r or*r fields*r for*r my*r sake*r will*r receive*r a*r hundred*r times*r as*r much*r and*r will*r inherit*r eternal*r life.*r
But*r many*r who*r are*r first*r will*r be*r last,*r and*r many*r who*r are*r last*r will*r be*r first.*r
